i18n.title: Text Classification Using Out-of-Core Learning
i18n.description: This lab provides an example of how to use scikit-learn for text classification using out-of-core learning. The goal is to learn from data that does not fit into main memory. To achieve this, we make use of an online classifier that supports the partial_fit method, which will be fed with batches of examples. To ensure that the feature space remains the same over time, we leverage a HashingVectorizer that will project each example into the same feature space. This is especially useful in the case of text classification where new features (words) may appear in each batch.

meta.title: Text Classification with Scikit-Learn | Out-of-Core Learning
meta.description: Learn how to use scikit-learn for text classification using out-of-core learning. Leverage online classifiers and HashingVectorizer to handle large datasets that don't fit in memory.
meta.keywords: text classification, scikit-learn, out-of-core learning, online classifiers, HashingVectorizer

i18n.title: 使用核外学习进行文本分类
i18n.description: 本实验提供了一个示例，展示如何使用scikit-learn通过核外学习进行文本分类。目标是从无法完全装入主内存的数据中进行学习。为实现这一点，我们使用了一个支持partial_fit方法的在线分类器，并向其输入一批批的示例。为确保特征空间随时间保持不变，我们利用了HashingVectorizer，它会将每个示例投影到相同的特征空间。这在文本分类中特别有用，因为每一批中可能会出现新的特征（单词）。
